item.title: 以色列对伊朗的打击表现出克制，石油每桶下跌近 4 美元
item.description: 以色列上周末对伊朗的报复性打击绕过了德黑兰的石油和核基础设施，没有中断能源供应，从而缓解了中东地区的地缘政治紧张局势。【原文：Oil prices tumbled nearly $4 a barrel on Monday after Israel's retaliatory strike on Iran over the weekend bypassed Tehran's oil and nuclear infrastructure and did not disrupt energy supplies, easing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East.】

item.title: 早间新闻日本大选冲击波拉开关键一周的序幕
item.description: 亚洲市场前瞻【原文：A look at the day ahead in Asian markets.】

item.title: 澳新银行集团因收购新科集团而蒙受约 1.3 亿美元的利润损失
item.description: 澳大利亚贷款机构澳新银行集团（ANZ Group）周一表示，由于收购Suncorp银行业务的影响，其2024年下半年的税后利润将受到1.96亿澳元（1.2963亿美元）的冲击。【原文：Australian lender ANZ Group said on Monday its 2024 second half profit will take a A$196 million ($129.63 million) hit after taxes due to impacts from the acquisition of Suncorp's banking business.】

item.title: 大众汽车考虑削减工资和奖金以节省 40 亿欧元 - Handelsblatt
item.description: 据《Handelsblatt》周日援引公司内部人士的话报道，大众汽车正在为其核心品牌探索一系列削减成本的措施，包括减薪 10%和冻结工资两年，以寻求节省 40 亿欧元。【原文：Volkswagen is exploring a series of cost-cutting measures for its core brand, including a 10% wage cut and a two-year wage freeze, as it seeks to save 4 billion euros, Handelsblatt newspaper reported on Sunday, citing company insiders.】

item.title: 日本日经指数和日元将因政治不确定性而下滑
item.description: 出口民调显示，日本首相石破茂领导的联盟将在周日的选举中失去议会多数席位，预计日本股市和日元将下跌，而较长期的国内政府债券收益率将上升。【原文：Japanese stocks and the yen are expected to fall while longer-dated domestic government bond yields are seen rising as exit polls suggest Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba's coalition is set to lose its parliamentary majority in Sunday's election.】

item.title: 消息人士称，Swiggy 再次将 IPO 估值下调至 113 亿美元，贝莱德和 CPPIB 将参与投资
item.description: 消息人士称，市场波动和现代印度公司首次亮相的低迷影响了市场情绪。【原文：Market volatility and the lacklustre debut of Hyundai India weigh on sentiment, sources said.】

item.title: 以色列克制打击伊朗，油价可能下跌
item.description: 分析师说，由于以色列上周末对伊朗的报复性打击绕过了德黑兰的石油和核基础设施，没有破坏能源供应，预计周一恢复交易后油价将下跌。【原文：Oil prices are expected to fall when trading resumes on Monday as Israel's retaliatory strike on Iran over the weekend bypassed Tehran's oil and nuclear infrastructure and did not disrupt energy supplies, analysts said.】

item.title: 据 The Information 报道，谷歌将开发可接管计算机的人工智能
item.description: 据 The Information 周六报道，Alphabet 旗下的谷歌公司正在开发人工智能技术，该技术可以接管网络浏览器，完成研究和购物等任务。【原文：Alphabet's Google is developing artificial intelligence technology that takes over a web browser to complete tasks such as research and shopping, The Information reported on Saturday.】

item.title: 贝利表示，英格兰银行将继续推行数字货币，以防银行资金短缺
item.description: 英格兰银行行长安德鲁-贝利（Andrew Bailey）周六表示，由于商业银行有可能无法跟上监管较少的科技公司的步伐，英格兰银行正在勉为其难地加紧工作，以创建一种大众可以使用的数字货币。【原文：The Bank of England is reluctantly pressing on with work to create a form of digital money accessible to the general public, as commercial banks risk failing to keep up with less-regulated tech firms, Governor Andrew Bailey said on Saturday.】

item.title: 利比亚国家石油公司称，意大利埃尼公司和英国石油公司在中断 10 年后恢复了在利比亚的陆上钻探活动
item.description: 利比亚国家石油公司（NOC）周六表示，意大利能源公司埃尼公司（Eni）和英国石油巨头英国石油公司（BP）已恢复在利比亚的勘探工作，此前两国曾于2014年停止陆上钻探。【原文：Italian energy company Eni and British oil giant BP have resumed exploration in Libya after onshore drilling was halted in 2014, Libya's national oil corporation (NOC) said on Saturday.】

item.title: 中国领导的亚洲国际投资银行行长批评发达国家设置贸易壁垒
item.description: 亚洲基础设施投资银行（亚投行）行长金立群周六批评发达经济体设置贸易壁垒，包括对可再生能源产品设置贸易壁垒，称全球经济中 "不再有自由贸易"。【原文：Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank (AIIB) President Jin Liqun on Saturday criticized advanced economies for creating trade barriers including for renewable energy goods, saying there was "no longer free trade" in the global economy.】

item.title: 消息人士称，在华为处理器上发现芯片后，台积电暂停向中国公司发货
item.description: 为保护美国国家安全，华为被限制购买该技术。【原文：Huawei is restricted from buying the technology to protect U.S. national security.】

item.title: 消息人士称，意大利警方因涉嫌非法访问数据库逮捕四人
item.description: 一位直接了解此事的人士告诉路透社，意大利警方已经软禁了四人，作为对一名前警察经营的私人情报机构涉嫌非法访问国家数据库的调查的一部分。【原文：Italian police have placed four people under house arrest as part of a probe into alleged illegal access to state databases by a private intelligence business run by a former policeman, a person with direct knowledge of the matter told Reuters.】

item.title: 中国在美方会议上对关税和制裁表示关切
item.description: 中国财政部周六表示，在华盛顿举行的两国经济工作组会议上，中国表达了对美国关税和俄罗斯相关制裁的关切。【原文：China expressed concern over U.S. tariffs and Russia-related sanctions during a meeting of the two countries' Economic Working Group in Washington, China's finance ministry said on Saturday.】

item.title: 阿里巴巴将支付 4.335 亿美元解决股东垄断索赔诉讼
item.description: 中国阿里巴巴周五表示，已同意支付 4.335 亿美元，以了结投资者指控该电子商务巨头垄断行为的美国集体诉讼。【原文：China's Alibaba said on Friday it had agreed to pay $433.5 million to settle a U.S. class-action lawsuit filed by investors alleging monopolistic practices by the e-commerce giant.】

item.title: 法院裁定，美国劳工委员会错误地命令特斯拉马斯克删除反工会推文
item.description: 美国一家有分歧的上诉法院周五裁定，全国劳资关系委员会命令特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）删除 2018 年的一条推文，称如果电动汽车制造商的员工加入工会，他们将失去股票期权，这种做法太过分了。【原文：A divided U.S. appeals court on Friday ruled that the National Labor Relations Board went too far by ordering Tesla CEO Elon Musk to delete a 2018 tweet stating employees of the electric vehicle maker would lose stock options if they unionized.】

item.title: 巴西央行行长称美国大选对长期利率构成压力
item.description: 巴西央行行长罗伯托-坎波斯-内托（Roberto Campos Neto）周五表示，市场正越来越多地将美国大选对通胀的 "高度 "影响计入长期利率期货。【原文：Brazil's central bank chief Roberto Campos Neto said on Friday that markets are increasingly factoring in the "highly" inflationary impacts of the U.S. election on long-term interest rate futures.】

item.title: 达美航空起诉 CrowdStrike 软件更新导致航班大规模中断
item.description: 达美航空公司周五在佐治亚州法院起诉了 CrowdStrike，因为 7 月份的一次全球性故障导致大量航班取消，130 万客户的旅行计划被打乱，航空公司损失超过 5 亿美元。【原文：Delta Air Lines on Friday sued CrowdStrike in a Georgia state court after a global outage in July caused mass flight cancellations, disrupted travel plans of 1.3 million customers and cost the carrier more than $500 million.】

item.title: 美国陪审团称 Masimo 智能手表侵犯苹果专利
item.description: 周五，苹果公司说服联邦陪审团，健康监测技术公司 Masimo 的智能手表侵犯了其两项设计专利。【原文：Apple convinced a federal jury on Friday that health monitoring tech company Masimo's smartwatches infringe two of its design patents.】

item.title: 巴西淡水河谷任命马塞洛-巴奇为新任首席财务官
item.description: 据周五发布的一份证券文件显示，巴西矿业公司淡水河谷董事会已批准马塞洛-巴奇（Marcelo Bacci）担任公司新任首席财务官。【原文：The board of Brazilian miner Vale has approved Marcelo Bacci as the company's new chief financial officer, according to a securities filing released on Friday, which added that the executive will start his new role on December 2.】

item.title: 美国起诉 Lyft，称该公司夸大司机盈利前景
item.description: 美国政府周五提起诉讼，指控 Lyft 的广告存在欺骗性，误导了潜在的司机，让他们不知道为这家共享汽车公司工作能赚多少钱。【原文：The U.S. government on Friday filed a lawsuit accusing Lyft of deceptive advertising that misled prospective drivers about how much money they might earn working for the ride-sharing company.】

item.title: 尽管遭遇旱灾，巴拿马运河本财年净收入仍增至 34.5 亿美元
item.description: 巴拿马运河管理机构周五表示，尽管大旱导致通过该水道的船只数量减少，但巴拿马运河在截至 9 月的财政年度中的利润仍增长了 9.5%，达到 34.5 亿美元。【原文：The Panama Canal's profit increased 9.5% in the fiscal year ended in September to $3.45 billion despite a severe drought that reduced the number of vessels that passed through the waterway, its authority said on Friday.】

item.title: 独家报道：消息人士称，Blackstone 正洽谈以 35 亿美元从 EQT 收购美国输油管股权
item.description: 熟悉此事的人士周五表示，私募股权投资公司 Blackstone 正在就以约 35 亿美元收购 EQT Corp 拥有的州际天然气管道的少数股权进行深入谈判。【原文：Private equity firm Blackstone is in advanced talks to acquire minority stakes in the interstate natural gas pipelines owned by EQT Corp for about $3.5 billion, people familiar with the matter said on Friday.】

item.title: Tether 首席执行官否认美国联邦调查员的调查
item.description: Tether 首席执行官保罗-阿德罗伊诺（Paolo Adroino）周五表示，在媒体报道联邦政府正在调查这家加密货币公司之后，"没有迹象表明 "该公司正在接受任何调查。【原文：Tether CEO Paolo Adroino said on Friday that there was "no indication" that the cryptocurrency firm was under any investigation after a media report that the federal government was probing the company.】

item.title: 银行高管称，欧元区政府不应干预银行整顿
item.description: 两位高级银行高管周五表示，欧盟各国政府应避免干预银行业整合，因为欧盟需要通过银行业整合来与其他主要经济体竞争。【原文：European Union governments should refrain from interfering with banking consolidation, which the bloc needs to compete with other major economies, two senior bank executives said on Friday.】

item.title: 国际货币基金组织（IMF）总裁格奥尔基耶娃认为存在财政风险，各国央行需谨慎降息
item.description: 国际货币基金组织总裁克里斯塔琳娜-格奥尔基耶娃（Kristalina Georgieva）周五表示，世界各国政府需要重建财政能力，各国央行应慎重考虑降息时机。【原文：Governments around the world need to rebuild fiscal capacity and central banks should think carefully about the timing of interest rate cuts, International Monetary Fund Managing Director Kristalina Georgieva said on Friday.】

item.title: Meta Platforms 将在人工智能聊天机器人中使用路透社新闻内容
item.description: Meta Platforms 周五表示，其人工智能聊天机器人将使用路透社的内容实时回答用户有关新闻和时事的问题，这是大型科技公司与新闻出版商之间最新的人工智能合作。【原文：Meta Platforms said on Friday its artificial intelligence chatbot will use Reuters content to answer user questions in real time about news and current events, the latest AI tie-up between a big technology company and a news publisher.】

item.title: 蒂尔的 Palantir 公司因为以色列工作而被挪威投资者抛弃
item.description: 北欧地区最大的投资者之一已经出售了其在 Palantir Technologies 公司的持股，原因是担心这家美国数据公司为以色列所做的工作可能会使这家资产管理公司面临违反国际人道法和人权的风险。【原文：One of the Nordic region's largest investors has sold its holdings in Palantir Technologies because of concerns that the U.S. data firm's work for Israel might put the asset manager at risk of violating international humanitarian law and human rights.】

item.title: 德国财长：美国和欧盟的贸易战只会带来输家
item.description: 德国财政部长克里斯蒂安-林德纳（Christian Lindner）在接受路透社采访时说，美国和欧盟之间的贸易冲突不会有赢家，只会有输家。【原文：A trade conflict between the United States and the European Union would not see any winner but only losers, German Finance Minister Christian Lindner told Reuters in an interview.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，波音公司正在探索出售其太空业务
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周五援引知情人士的话报道，波音公司正在探索出售其太空业务。【原文：Boeing is exploring the sale of its space business, the Wall Street Journal reported on Friday, citing people familiar with the matter.】
